trends: There have been 4 other sightings in League City
There were no other sightings in League City on or around December 31st 2007
Summary: we saw a circle/s darting around spastically and shooting light out randomly
divs: sighting detailsmy 6yr old daughter and i would lay in bed at night and read stories and look out our sky light earlier this month, when we noticed a bizaar object that appeard to be "hovering" over our lake although it also appeard to be very high in the sky it would often dart around as thought it was not in control of itself. then it appeared within a few minutes 4 to 6 some sort of aircraft would appear near it. then the object would dart randomly and appeard to be flashing lights towards the aircraft, very sharp and random lights would flash periodically. it was so bizaar that the first time we saw it we hardly even spoke to each other and just watched. after about 11 mintues or so it was late and she needed to get to sleep so we briefly discussed what we thought it to be, "she described it as a big light that would flash and that was chasing airplanes". i on the other hand, was very skeptical having never believed in ufo's or seen anything remotely close to this and was sure my eyes were playing tricks on me at the age of 43 and was even reluctant to tell my husband, for fear he would think i too was seeing things. however, that was not our only time to see it! it came back and this time i was a bit scared but the article from stephenville had not been posted\written and i decided i needed to tell someone, so the next morning we told my husband who laughed! again, it was late in the night and out our skyllight you could see the entire "light show". so this time i did get up and walk out to our balcony to see if i could hear anything, since we are in the flight path of both ellington field and houston hobby airport i thought it might be some weird aircraft i was not accustomed to seeing and wanted to see if i could hear anything, (whent he jets fly over it is very noisy and is true then large planes that are flying low due to landing or taking off) but the only sound was a bit of traffic off i-45. this time, i did ask my daughter "to describe to daddy what we saw the next morning". he of course laughed and said it was some star but she and i know that stars do not move, and if they are flashing lights they are generally falling and not back in the same spot later. also, it was clearly different than anything i have ever seen in my 43 years of living and i hope i do not see the "light show" again! my gut instinct says "it is not a military training mission" unless they have invented some sort of new unreleased aircraft that plays chase wtih them in the wee hours of night. if so, i am going to be very unhappy since gas prices are through the roof, couldn't and shouldn't we be saving that fuel for better use??? sincerely, ss. and family
